channel.title: Website IP Finder
channel.description:
Just something I whipped up for anyone who finds it useful. What it does is simple. Just type a website address and click "Find IP". It will pop up with the websites IP address in the seconds textbox.
http://www.mediafire.com/?45to6gsozi2uuob
Example: [img]http://img819.imageshack.us/img819/549/aee30320cc8a4ce5a27e54a.png[/img]
If your going to complain just get off this topic now because I wont listen to any trollers. -Removed for you iDavid D:<!-
[center][u]Made using Visual Basic[/u][/center]
Source code (requested) [code]Imports System.Net Public Class Form1
Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click Dim Hostname As IPHostEntry = Dns.GetHostByName(TextBox1.Text) Dim ip As IPAddress() = Hostname.AddressList TextBox2.Text = ip(0).ToString End Sub
Private Sub LinkLabel1_LinkClicked(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.Forms.LinkLabelLinkClickedEventArgs) Handles LinkLabel1.LinkClicked AboutBox1.Show() End Sub
Private Sub Form1_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load
End Sub End Class[/code] And a lil decorative touches, but thats the main code. You need 2 textboxes and a button. (If your not adding an about box, remove that little part)

item.title: Website IP Finder
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:12, topic:453368”][quote author=t4 link=topic=556211.msg4072351#msg4072351 date=1344470157]

ping hostname
Ctrl + C to stop the pinging once you get the IP.
Couldn’t be easier.

First off, for programs like this where it doesn’t have a real purpose (as yes there is ping to get the ip, etc) include the source as that’s the only real contribution you can make with it. Secondly, don’t ask for reputation

have you two never heard of nslookup? it’s on *NIX and windows
[/quote]…? Or you know… read my post. I wasn’t saying anything was better than anything else (I even included etc), and like bowser said ping works just as well in certain cases (and better in others). Nslookup wont give you an accurate representation of what your computer can see, they really just serve different purposes.[/quote]
we went over this on irc:

ping uses local dns cache (meaning if dns updates you’re fukt)
ping doesn’t allow querying of other dns servers other than the cache
ping doesn’t work for cname records, or anything other than A
ping doesn’t work for AAA records since it’ll just pick one

doesn’t matter though, just making sure people know

Read full topic

item.title: Website IP Finder
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Very, very simple.

<?
if ($_POST['sub_address'] && $_POST['address']) 
{
$ip_address = gethostbyname($_POST['address']);
if ($ip_address == $_POST['address'])
echo "Invalid domain or the IP couldn't be found.";
else
echo "<b>" . $_POST['address'] . "</b>'s IP is: " . $ip_address;
}

echo "<center><hr>

<form method=\"post\" action=\"" . $_SERVER['PHP_SELF'] . "\">
<b>Domain:</b><br />
<input type=\"text\" name=\"address\"><br />
<input type=\"submit\" name=\"sub_address\" value=\"Check\">
</form>
";
?>

Nevertheless, good job!

Read full topic
